title: Firefox Japanese Fonts Messed Up
content:
I am using Firefox on Debian 10 (78.6.1esr) and my Japanese fonts got messed up after I installed a new font on the system. I installed the font into my Debian user folder, and it applied to everything as the default font. The fix was pretty easy, I simply removed it and everything want back to normal, except Firefox. Firefox for some reason is the only thing insistent on continuing to use the font, despite my font settings in Firefox set to use a more standard font. It wouldn't be so bad but the font in question doesn't have all the characters so the display is rather hideous in some cases. I tried to reset Firefox by renaming ~/.mozilla/firefox to ~/.mozilla/firefox.old, but the font remains. I've ran with it for about a month but I cannot take it anymore and have spent a days worth of hours trying to fix it.

I've attached on image showing the display, and another showing my font settings. about:config does not show the offending font.

Thanks!
creator: vgwidt

title: Params sub-tab in Network tab not visible
content: I am on v85 of Firefox and dont see a Params tab in Network tab.

title: How to set the default upload directory
content:
For ome reason when I upload a file to my website Firefox does not open the directory I last used to upload a file. Instead it seems to have got stuck on some arbitrary directory.

This is SO annoying as I generally have multiple files to upload usually from the same directory, which means, now, that each time I have change from that arbitrary directory to the directory I want to upload from

How can I get Firefox to behave as it always has? Which was, that when I uploaded a file from my laptop, it opened the directory folder I last used to upload from
creator: ririri

title: Größe des "Datei soeichern unter"-Dialoges einstellen
content:
Hallo,

derzeit ist meine Dateiauswahlbox immer auf maiximale Größe eingestellt. Das ist auf Dauer etwas lästig. Wo kann ich die Konfiguration so ändern, dass ich das Fenster in der Größe variiieren kann?

Grüßle

creator: BIT_fr

title: Cannot undo effects after uninstalling unapproved Parental Control add-on
content:
After testing out an unapproved Parental Control add-on for Firefox, I decided to uninstalled it. But Firefox still redirects webpages (depending if it contains certain keywords on the page) to a blank page as if that add-on were still installed. Other web browsers are not affected.

Where on my computer is Firefox getting these instructions (including that custom list of key words)? And how do I undo this?
creator: andrew_ghattas

title: Sites no longer responding in Firefox
content:
I am having issues with a couple of sites I go to often. The first is https://cnrtl.fr/ and the second is https://gallica.bnf.fr Both of these sites are working in my other web browsers but Firefox continues to say they are not secure. The first is a dictionary and the second is a site with manuscripts and documents from the 19th century and earlier which are in PDF format mostly.

These sites just just stopped working after Firefox 85 update.
creator: charles.deschenes

title: Issue logging into email through firefox
content: I was attempting to log in to my work email using firefox. When I attempt to log-in, it comes up with a message that says "disable ad blockers, enable Javascript, or use a different browser." I checked the add-ons and currently do not have any set up. I have enabled Javascript. I tried resetting firefox to default settings. I tried turning off enhanced tracking protection. I even attempted using Microsoft edge and nothing is working to help me get into my email. I was able to use firefox earlier today and did not have this problem. Any help would be appreciated.
creator: ninjaluvr78

title: Change time zone in the browser for a specific website without a third party add on
content:
I have resist fingerprint settings turned on because I use keyboard shortcuts to open specific webpages / notes and I need the pages to be the same size when I launch the new instance of the browser.

but now the browser thinks I am in UTC. I need the browser to report I am in a different time zone, because nextcloud keeps assuming that my browser is telling the truth.

I cant / wont install third party add ons.
creator: yeqkmhj

title: Cannot play videos on Amazon/Netflix
content:
Unable to play any videos on Amazon/Netflix. Just says Video unavailable. The same videos play just fine on Safari. Using a Mac Air M1.

After some investigation, it looks like the OpenH264 is not downloading (OpenH264 Video Codec provided by Cisco Systems, Inc. will be installed shortly.) Widevine is installed on the other hand.
creator: 91sanjay
